meanings.definition: Trypsinogens: inactive precursors of the enzyme trypsin
meanings.sent1: The trypsinogens in the body wait to become trypsin.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study trypsinogens to understand how trypsin is formed.
meanings.sent3: The trypsinogens threw a party, but only trypsin showed up!
meanings.sent4: Her potential was like trypsinogens waiting to unleash the power of trypsin.
meanings.sent5: The mystery of trypsinogens transforming into trypsin fascinated researchers.

meanings.definition: Trypsinogens: proteins produced in the pancreas
meanings.sent1: The pancreas releases trypsinogens to aid digestion.
meanings.sent2: Doctors monitor the levels of trypsinogens in the pancreas.
meanings.sent3: The trypsinogens in the pancreas formed a band called 'The Enzyme Crew'.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as strong as the production of trypsinogens in the pancreas.
meanings.sent5: The pancreas's trypsinogens production was crucial for proper digestion.

meanings.definition: Trypsinogens: substances involved in the digestion of proteins
meanings.sent1: Traces of trypsinogens help break down proteins in the body.
meanings.sent2: Nutritionists emphasize the role of trypsinogens in protein digestion.
meanings.sent3: The trypsinogens worked together like a well-oiled protein-digesting machine.
meanings.sent4: The journey of proteins through digestion mirrored the path of trypsinogens.
meanings.sent5: The effectiveness of trypsinogens in protein digestion amazed the researchers.
